title: Frozen Franz Josef Land
description: Located just 600 miles (970 kilometers) from the North Pole, Franz Josef Land is perpetually coated with ice. Glaciers cover roughly 85 percent of the archipelago’s land masses, and sea ice floats in the channels between islands even in the summertime.
theme:
WINTER. Special gallery to set the mood
for snowy days
